questions.text: What is the SI unit of length?
questions.solution: The meter (m) is the fundamental SI unit of length, defined as the distance traveled by light in vacuum in 1/299,792,458 of a second.

questions.text: Which of the following is a derived unit?
questions.solution: Newton (N) is a derived unit for force, defined as kg⋅m/s². The other options are fundamental SI units.

questions.text: What does the term 'precision' refer to in measurements?
options: How close a measurement is to the true value
How close repeated measurements are to each other
The smallest division on a measuring instrument
The difference between maximum and minimum values
questions.correct_answer: How close repeated measurements are to each other
questions.solution: Precision refers to the reproducibility of measurements - how close repeated measurements are to each other, regardless of accuracy.

questions.text: What is the dimensional formula for velocity?
questions.solution: Velocity = displacement/time = [L]/[T] = [L T⁻¹], where L is length and T is time.

questions.text: How many significant figures are in the number 0.00456?
questions.solution: Leading zeros are not significant. The significant figures are 4, 5, and 6, making it 3 significant figures.
